title: Proportional Figures
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501052750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501052750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Proportional Figures**

Proportional figures are those that have [advance widths](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501052750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/advance%20width) that vary, based upon the relative width of each character. Proportional figures also typically incorporate [kerning](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501052750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/kerning) so that they space evenly. This figure scheme is better suited for text whereas [tabular figures](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501052750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/tabular%20figures) (those that share a common width) are better suited for setting figures in columns.
